content.description: Easy climbing to reach a high bolt, then pull through a tough bulge/roof to thin moves just below the big horizontal break. Cop a sit down rest before pulling another strenuous roof. With the second roof behind you, enjoy a few bolts worth of awesome juggy climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: 12 bolts + anchors. A fixed cable draw at the first roof and a long chain hanging down to clip your quickdraw into at the second roof.
content.location: Continuing down past the New Zoo area to a cool, huge amphitheater. This steep, long route marks the beginning of an even newer area known as the Bird Cage Sector.

content.description: Crimp your way up this techy face.
content.location: Around the corner from Romance Explosion. Look for a flake system at the start and a large heuco about 15' up.

content.description: Jump off the boulder to start and enjoy crimping your way up the face.
Less than vertical climb with a tough boulder move near the bottom and a spicy move to the anchors.
content.location: First route to the right of the bolted arete Dirty Bird.

content.description: Fun and techy line that requires balance and a calm head.
content.location: Right of Lone Coyote in the steep gully.

content.description: Climb easy climbing up fun slab moves to a shut down crimpy crux right before the anchors.
content.location:
The route is on the ledge on the far right side of the crag, to the left of

Can of Biscuits

, directly in front of a comfortable belay tree

content.description: Crimp your way up to the hard move before the anchor.
content.location: Walk along the trail until it meets back up with the wall and look for the bolted line to the right of the mixed route, Bumpin' With Bulldog.

content.description: Bust a low crux off the boulder to gain blocky jugs down low with a couple of powerful moves. A good rest leads to an exciting more vertical voyage up top.
content.location: Far right side of the new Zoo, just left of the Birdcage slabs. It is the obvious easiest-looking line in the big amphitheater overhead after you pass Sons of Perdition and walk through a low marshy section with a seasonal waterfall.

content.description: Climb the bolted arete on the far right side of the crag. Start with bouldery moves to a rest then more bouldery moves to a rest and then finally climb out some giant jugs over a bulge on to the slaby finish to the top.
content.location: On the far right side of the crag. Climbing the arete to the left of two other slaby routes.

content.description: As the name of the route suggests, crimp through the first section to a series of jugs. Rest well here before crimping through the next section and finally knock out the final boulder problem before the anchors.
content.location: Walk right of Snake Charmer until you come across this tall and stunning golden face.

content.description: Start of the ground on the slightly manky rock to gain large jugs about ten feet up. Climb the gigantic holds up the slab just to the left of the crack to anchors.
content.protection: As the first moves are the crux if you arn't a solid climber you may want a spot. Otherwise decent gear to bolted anchors.
content.location: Follow the cliff all the way to the right. Cimb up a muddy gulley to gain a ledge. This is the obvious left facing dihedral on the right side of the ledge.

content.description: Follow plates and edges along a meandering crack while placing small pro until you reach a small bulge where the rock changes into pockets. Clip a bolt and make a few exciting moves to get up to the second bolt. Chain anchors.
content.protection: Small gear needed for the lower section, then 2 bolts on the upper pocketed section.
content.location: From the ledge walk back down to the trail and continue right until the trail steepens and meets back up with the wall. Look left and you'll see an attractive finger crack and some bolts. This is the leftmost line which has 2 bolts about midway up.

content.description: Make a burly move off some cheater stones to mantel on to a ledge. Move right up big holds make your way on to the slab and climb slab for what seems forever to the top.
content.location: From the muddy super overhanging area near the sometimes dry waterfall scramble up a muddy hill. At the top this route starts off the obvious pile of cheater stones.

content.description:
Begin in the hand/finger crack, making your way up to the ledge. Mentally prepare for the crux ahead. Spicy!

The direct start to the left goes at about 12b.
